intro: Erigeron diversifolius, commonly known as the diverse-leaved fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, prairies, and disturbed soils, and it thrives in full sun. Its leaves are varied in shape, ranging from lanceolate to ovate, and are often covered in fine hairs. The flowers bloom in late summer to early fall, producing a showy display that attracts pollinators like bees and butterflies.
